title: Minar-e-Pakistan
description: Tower of Pakistan built to commemorate the Lahore Resolution where Pakistan's independence was demanded.
detail: Constructed between 1960 and 1968, Minar-e-Pakistan stands at 70 meters. It blends Mughal, Islamic, and modern architecture, symbolizing Pakistan’s struggle for freedom.

title: Badshahi Mosque
description: 17th-century Mughal-era mosque, one of the largest in the world with capacity for 100,000 worshippers.
detail: Commissioned by Emperor Aurangzeb in 1671, the mosque’s red sandstone structure and marble domes showcase Mughal grandeur at its peak.

title: Faisal Mosque
description: Modern mosque shaped like a desert tent, the largest in South Asia with striking contemporary design.
detail: Gifted by King Faisal of Saudi Arabia, it was completed in 1986. Its unique tent-like design was inspired by the desert Bedouin tents.

title: Lahore Fort
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site showcasing Mughal architecture with the famous Sheesh Mahal (Palace of Mirrors).
detail: The fort’s history spans over a thousand years, with additions from Mughal, Sikh, and British rulers, making it a layered historical masterpiece.

title: Hunza Valley
description: Breathtaking mountain valley known for its turquoise lakes, glaciers, and the legendary longevity of its people.
detail: Located in Gilgit-Baltistan, Hunza is famous for the Passu Cones, Attabad Lake, and a culture rooted in harmony and hospitality.

title: Mohenjo-Daro
description: Ancient Indus Valley Civilization city dating back to 2500 BCE, one of the world's earliest major urban settlements.
detail: Its planned streets, drainage systems, and granaries show the sophistication of the Indus Valley civilization long before modern cities.

title: K2 Base Camp
description: Gateway to the world's second highest mountain (8,611m) in the spectacular Karakoram range.
detail: The trek to K2 Base Camp is among the toughest in the world, taking adventurers through glaciers, rugged terrain, and breathtaking views.

title: Mazar-e-Quaid
description: White marble mausoleum of Muhammad Ali Jinnah, founder of Pakistan, in Karachi.
detail: Designed by Yahya Merchant, the mausoleum’s simplicity and grandeur reflect Jinnah’s vision for Pakistan.

title: Shalimar Gardens
description: Mughal-era gardens built in 1641 with 410 fountains, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
detail: Built by Emperor Shah Jahan, the gardens represent the Persian-style Charbagh layout with terraces and flowing water channels.

title: Gwadar Port
description: Deep-sea port on the Arabian Sea, centerpiece of the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) project.
detail: Strategically located near key shipping routes, Gwadar is envisioned as a trade and logistics hub connecting Asia, Africa, and Europe.
